data.text: @Ragusaecomites I think it's very important to point out that the number of families paid out in vaccine court is a tiny percentage of the number of families affected by vaccine injuries. It's estimated that only 1% of people file VAERS reports, likely because they were never told about it.

@redheadmom8 I’m genuinely sorry to hear of your pain and your daughter’s situation which of course will shape your approach to vaccination. Hoping I won’t upset you further I will conclude by saying statistically, vaccines are safe & effective. I also accept statistics can be cold and hurt.
@Ragusaecomites My daughter is vaccine injured, so while the number may seem minute to most, it affects real families. It's actually comparable to the death rate from Covid.

@redheadmom8 Thanks Shelly. I see from https://t.co/kIWNroGohv that this $4bn was paid to 5,376 claimants over 30 years.   That’s an average of 179 a year out of a population of 328 million.  Like the UK a minute percentage which suggests to me that most US vaccines are safe.
@Ragusaecomites $4 billion has been paid out for vaccine injuries in the US so far. (This was as of 2019.)

@redheadmom8 In the UK we have the Vaccine Damages Act which provides a welfare payment if you are severely disabled by ANY vaccine. From 1978-2017, 900 payments were made: an average of 39 a year.  Most of 68m population were vaccinated as a child so 39 a year is sad but a minute percentage.
